name: actually
posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

dsense.name: actually
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

example.eg: I didn't actually see her - I just heard her voice.
example.egtrans: 实际上我并没有看见她，只是听到了她的声音。
那么到底发生了什么事呢？

dsense.name: actually
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: used in sentences in which there is information that is in some way surprising or the opposite of what most people would expect
trans_examp.trans_cn: （表示意外或与通常预期的相反）居然，竟然

example.eg: I didn't like him at first, but in the end I actually got quite fond of him.
example.egtrans: 起初我对他并没有好感，可最后我竟然挺喜欢他的。

example.eg: I'm one of the few people who doesn't actually like champagne.
example.egtrans: 有个别人还真是不喜欢香槟酒，我就是其中之一。

example.eg: Don't tell me he actually paid for you!
example.egtrans: 别跟我说他居然替你付了钱！

dsense.name: actually
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: used as a way of making a sentence slightly more polite, for example when you are expressing an opposing opinion, correcting what someone else has said, or refusing an offer
trans_examp.trans_cn: （用于礼貌地表示反对、纠正他人或拒绝他人提议等）其实，说实话，实际上

example.eg: "Alexander looks like he'd be good at sports." "Actually, he's not."
example.egtrans: “亚历山大看上去很擅长运动。”“事实并非如此。”

example.eg: Actually, Gavin, it was Tuesday of last week, not Wednesday.
example.egtrans: 实际上呢，加文，那是上星期二，不是星期三。

example.eg: "Do you mind if I smoke?" "Well, actually, I'd rather you didn't."
example.egtrans: “我抽支烟你介意吗？”“嗯，说实话，我希望你还是别抽。”
